page.title: 08PILSLEY PEOPLE'S HOLIDAYS 1
page.content:
A survey in Pilsley Primary School showed that most families took their holidays on the East Coast, especially at Skegness. This is probably due to ease of travel, plenty of caravan and chalet accommodation and the existence of the Miners' Holiday Camp. Other East Coast resorts visited were Scarborough, Bridlington, Cleethorpes and Great Yarmouth.
Any holidays on the North West Coast were mainly taken at Blackpool. Other holiday areas visited were the South Coast and the West Country. Almost without exception, holidays are taken by the sea, probably owing to our home area being so far inland. Holidays abroad are rare. (See Page 9 for details)
Lindsey and Daniella (10)
